flow.descriptionCdata:
e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.40a6bd03-044f-4d5d-a363-d3389b8c3c3d.prompt=User Identifier e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.4a8372bd-d66a-4c27-b334-0eb5b5f1282d.description=
This operation is used to send a smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: true. 
    readReceipt - The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false. 
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false. 
    attachments - A delimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    headers - This input contains extra headers you want to be added in the mail. The input has a 'Map' format. Header names are separated from header values through a column delimiter and headers will be separated between them by a row delimiter.
Example\:
    Sensitivity\:Company-Confidential
    message-type\:Multiple Part
    Sensitivity\:Personal
In the above example, the columnDelimiter is "\:" and the rowDelimiter is the new line. You can define multiple values for the same header like in the example above. The delimiters can have multiple characters, but be careful that the rowDelimiter is not a substring of the columnDelimiter.
    rowDelimiter - The delimiter that separates headers in the 'headers' input.
Default value\: "\:"
Examples\: '|', '\='
    columnDelimiter - The delimiter that separates the header name from header value on the same row.
Default value\: "\n"	
Examples\: ';', '\#'
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - If SMTP authentication is needed, the password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32, EUC-JP, ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, Windows-31J.
Default value\: UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: quoted-printable, base64, 7bit, 8bit, binary, x-token.
Default value\: quoted-printable (or Q Encoding).
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments.
Default value\: ','
    encryptionKeystore - The path to the pks12 formatted keystore used to encrypt the mail.
    encryptionKeyAlias - The alias of a RSA key pair from the encryptionKeystore. The public key from the pair will be used to encrypt the mail. The key pair must not have password. The recommended key size is 2048 bit or higher.
    encryptionKeystorePassword - The password for the encryptionKeystore.
    encryptionAlgorithm - The encryption algorithm applied on the key from the keystore in order to encypt email parts. 
Default value\: AES256_CBC.
Valid values\: DES_EDE3_CBC, RC2_CBC, IDEA_CBC, CAST5_CBC, AES128_CBC, AES192_CBC, AES256_CBC, CAMELLIA128_CBC, CAMELLIA192_CBC, CAMELLIA256_CBC, SEED_CBC, DES_EDE3_WRAP, AES128_WRAP, AES256_WRAP, CAMELLIA128_WRAP, CAMELLIA192_WRAP, CAMELLIA256_WRAP, SEED_WRAP.
    enableTLS - Enables starttls. If the server supports TLS or SSL, the communications will be secured by TLS or SSL. If it doesn't support TLS or SSL the communication will be unsecure.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for sending the mail message.

Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
3. You can use KeyStore Explorer to obtain RSA Keystore with keyPairs for encryption/decryption.
    3.1 If you get "llegal key size exception" you don't have JCE Unlimited Strength installed.
e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.6b214ee8-d1d8-4c74-94b4-dfbff77f85e3.prompt=User Identifier e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.71b0f054-ebd1-43bb-b533-e95a7b05dc3c.prompt=Artifact ID e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.b9d7acd5-1aa6-4f4c-8774-7f1f5eae4d74.description=
This workflow returns the details of the given service subscription id.

Inputs-
svcSubscriptionId –   Service Subscription Id
userIdentifier  - User Identifier id
authType - The authentication type that this operation uses when trying to execute the request on the target server.
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
Default value\: anonymous - authentication not used when executing the request.
kerberosConfFile - The path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty the kdc (Key Distribution Center) and realm will get their values from the full domain name which is obtained from the url of the web server.
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
socketTimeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the data to be retrieved. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A socketTimeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
useCookies - If true, enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true.
followRedirects - If true, the GET command automatically follows redirects. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true
proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: true
keystore - URL of the keystore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS client authentication is not to be used.
keystorePassword - Password to unlock the keystore.
trustKeystore - URL of the truststore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore.

Outputs-
subEndDate –  Service subscription end date
subStartDate – Service subscription start date
document  – returned XML document from API
e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.c1df5ab3-825f-4fec-b463-32fb0021c1a7.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.d2487d84-968d-4851-9e7b-22ac0e48dda2.prompt=Resource Provider ID e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.description=
Send Failure Email Notification \: Notify the consumer and Admin on Failure
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: true. 
    readReceipt - The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false. 
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false. 
    attachments - A delimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    headers - This input contains extra headers you want to be added in the mail. The input has a 'Map' format. Header names are separated from header values through a column delimiter and headers will be separated between them by a row delimiter.
Example\:
    Sensitivity\:Company-Confidential
    message-type\:Multiple Part
    Sensitivity\:Personal
In the above example, the columnDelimiter is "\:" and the rowDelimiter is the new line. You can define multiple values for the same header like in the example above. The delimiters can have multiple characters, but be careful that the rowDelimiter is not a substring of the columnDelimiter.
    rowDelimiter - The delimiter that separates headers in the 'headers' input.
Default value\: "\:"
Examples\: '|', '\='
    columnDelimiter - The delimiter that separates the header name from header value on the same row.
Default value\: "\n"	
Examples\: ';', '\#'
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - If SMTP authentication is needed, the password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32, EUC-JP, ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, Windows-31J.
Default value\: UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: quoted-printable, base64, 7bit, 8bit, binary, x-token.
Default value\: quoted-printable (or Q Encoding).
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments.
Default value\: ','
    encryptionKeystore - The path to the pks12 formatted keystore used to encrypt the mail.
    encryptionKeyAlias - The alias of a RSA key pair from the encryptionKeystore. The public key from the pair will be used to encrypt the mail. The key pair must not have password. The recommended key size is 2048 bit or higher.
    encryptionKeystorePassword - The password for the encryptionKeystore.
    encryptionAlgorithm - The encryption algorithm applied on the key from the keystore in order to encypt email parts. 
Default value\: AES256_CBC.
Valid values\: DES_EDE3_CBC, RC2_CBC, IDEA_CBC, CAST5_CBC, AES128_CBC, AES192_CBC, AES256_CBC, CAMELLIA128_CBC, CAMELLIA192_CBC, CAMELLIA256_CBC, SEED_CBC, DES_EDE3_WRAP, AES128_WRAP, AES256_WRAP, CAMELLIA128_WRAP, CAMELLIA192_WRAP, CAMELLIA256_WRAP, SEED_WRAP.
    enableTLS - Enables starttls. If the server supports TLS or SSL, the communications will be secured by TLS or SSL. If it doesn't support TLS or SSL the communication will be unsecure.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for sending the mail message.

Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.
e23dcc50-0e15-41a6-8171-379cb28b7f5b.e9bf53b5-306f-48cf-9ce2-58230bc920d4.description=
Service to perform an HTTP GET via the Java HTTP Client

Inputs\:
url - the url to attempt to retrieve.
username - the username to authenticate to url with.
password - the password for username.
timeout - a timeout after which the connection should be terminated, or 0 for no timeout.
useCookies - Enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. valid options are\: true/false
followRedirects - specifies whether or not the get command should automatically follow redirects.
trustAllRoots - enables weak security over SSL. A SSH certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it. valid options are\: true/false
proxy - a proxy to use when accessing the web site.
proxyPort - a port on the proxy to connect to.
proxyUsername - a username to use when connecting to the proxy.
proxyPassword - a password to use when connecting to the proxy.
encodeURL - perform URL encoding.
userAgent - if the HTTP header USER_AGENT needs to be overridden, pass in the value here
characterSet - the characterSet for HTTP Get request and response. Default is UTF-8.

Responses\:
success - URL retrieved successfully.
failure - The url could not be retrieved.
flow.name: Send Email Notification

staticBinding.value:
HP Helion Managed Private Cloud

 

Hello Customer.

The execution of the lifecycle action Power Off Server for your service "${Server_name}" was successful

What to do next?

Further Help and information
Please note: This is an automated generated and sent email - responses to this mail will not be received by the the HP Helion Managed Private Cloud Operation Team.
If you need addtional support you can contact the HP Helion Managed Private Cloud operation here: orlin.vasilev@hpe.com,casvv@hpe.com,lucien.vingerhoed@hpe.com,nicolas.herregat@hpe.com,els.raemen@hpe.com

<html> <head> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"> </head>
<body>
Dear CSA User,</br></br>
Your requested has been initiated to update</br></br>
Subscription Details:</br></br>
Subscription Name: ${SubscriptionName}</br> Subscription Id: ${SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID} </br> Subscription User: ${SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL}</br></br>
Kindly Contact your System Administrator for any queries.</br></br>
Regards</br> CSA Team </br></br>
</body> </html>
